channel.description: The top News headlines from The Sydney Morning Herald. For all the news, visit https://www.smh.com.au
channel.title: Sydney Morning Herald - Latest News

item.description: If you suspect you or a family member has coronavirus you should call (not visit) your GP or ring the national Coronavirus Health Information Hotline on 1800 020 080.
item.title: Coronavirus updates LIVE: Global COVID-19 cases top 5.9 million as Australian death toll stands at 103

item.description: Angry crowds looted shops, set fires and left a path of damage that stretched for kilometres during violent protests over the death of a black man in police custody.
item.title: Violent protests rock Minneapolis for second straight night

item.description: Jock Palfreeman had served 11 years of a 20-year sentence for murder and attempted murder in the 2007 stabbing of two Bulgarians.
item.title: Australian jailed for 2007 murder in Bulgaria now free to go home

item.dc:creator: Lisa Visentin
item.description: The Berejiklian government is bracing for as much as $20 billion to be wiped from state coffers as the Powerhouse Museum and ANZ Stadium upgrade are plunged into uncertainty.
item.title: Budget blow puts Powerhouse Museum and ANZ Stadium projects in doubt

item.dc:creator: Harriet Alexander
item.description: The NSW government is on the brink of signing off on plans that will set out how the rivers are managed for the next decade. But some say the plans deliver for a few at the expense of the many, and are willing to take drastic action.
item.title: Legal action looms over water sharing plans

item.dc:creator: Kate Aubusson
item.description: Health authorities have no idea how more than one in four children with locally acquired COVID-19 were infected with the virus.
item.title: Source of infection a mystery for 17 COVID cases among children in NSW

item.dc:creator: Ella Archibald-Binge
item.description: The author of a damning report into NSW child protection has criticised the decision to reduce funding to the peak body for Aboriginal kids in out-of-home care.
item.title: 'Progress will be lost': Funding cuts to hit Aboriginal child protection

item.dc:creator: Mike Foley
item.description: Australia’s greenhouse gas output according to the national inventory for 2019 is not on the downward trajectory required to meet the Paris Agreement.
item.title: Australia's emissions reductions falling short of climate commitment

item.dc:creator: Andrew Webster
item.description: The media won't lose interest in the Souths fullback any time soon. The only one who can change the channel is Mitchell himself... and there's one man at Redfern who can help him out.
item.title: The one person Latrell Mitchell must listen to

item.dc:creator: Matt O'Sullivan
item.description: The state's consumer watchdog is also investigating the certification of the apartment building next to the cracked Mascot Towers.
item.title: Mascot Towers owners seek $15m from developer of neighbouring building

item.dc:creator: Elizabeth Knight
item.description: Rupert Murdoch was hoping Antony Catalano was the answer to stop the cash burn from News Corp Australia's 100 regional and suburban print newspapers.
item.title: 'The Cat' refused to play and scratched Murdoch's plan A

item.description: Free daily horoscope for each star sign from renowned Astrologer Hedy Damari. Forecasts for the day ahead in life, love and career.
item.title: Your Daily Horoscope for Friday, May 29

item.description: Got a new HR policy? It might be time to ask your workers, rather than managers, how they feel about it.
item.title: Has HR forgotten about employees?

item.dc:creator: Helen Pitt
item.description: The decision to stop the print version of the Parramatta Advertiser is part of wider cuts by News Corp across the country.
item.title: 'From typesetter to tea lady': end of a Murdoch newspaper era in Sydney

item.dc:creator: Michaela Whitbourn
item.description: A judge has condemned the treatment of an Indigenous man with a mild intellectual disability who has been under tough supervision orders for more than a decade.
item.title: Five-year supervision order still in place against Aboriginal man after 11 years

item.dc:creator: Toby Crockford
item.description: The parents of an 18-year-old driver who killed himself and four others hope to prevent the tragedy from happening again.
item.title: Teen's parents turn road tragedy into mission to save young Queensland lives

item.description: How dare we deny a pay rise to the people who have worked tirelessly for the welfare of us all in the recent crises.
item.title: Freezing the pay of vital workers smacks of hypocrisy

item.dc:creator: Nathanael Cooper
item.description: After cancelling their upcoming season of Who's Your Baghdaddy in Sydney, the producers decided to innovate and take the show online.
item.title: Ambitious plan to stage full musical live online

item.dc:creator: Lyn Maccallum
item.description: Thousands march in bridge walk, MCA on a winner and actors in the ring.
item.title: In the Herald: May 29, 2000

item.description: Governments should invest directly in home building – with no burden on taxpayers.
item.title: To fix our housing industry, governments need skin in the game

item.dc:creator: Anna Patty
item.description: Colin Fisher was inspired to adapt his technology and manufacture a new product: a reusable face mask.
item.title: Start it up: industry unites with universities to innovate in pandemic

item.description: On 29 May, 1973, US anthropologist Dr. Mead, in Sydney for the Building Science Forum conference, spent the day inspecting social housing and talking to tenants.
item.title: From the Archives, 1973: Dr Mead's tour of social housing

item.dc:creator: Nathanael Cooper
item.description: From Nirvana to Lauryn Hill, the '90s was a good decade for music.
item.title: Essential '90s albums that define the decade

item.description: Recent signs of a closer relationship between government, unions and employers are positive, but they need to step up and establish a new social contract at work.
item.title: Time for a new social contract

item.description: aa
item.title: Leaving a lasting legacy

item.description: Trivia and word buffs: test your knowledge with today's superquiz and Target.
item.title: Target and superquiz, Friday, May 29

item.dc:creator: Samantha Hutchinson
item.description: It appears it could be years before North Sydney Council manages to get its pool redevelopment off the ground. But Georges River Council is close to bettering North Sydney in the pool controversy stakes.
item.title: Thanks for the memories, council turns back on Morrison money to save Memorial Pool

item.dc:creator: Nick McKenzie
item.description: Investigations into unauthorised leaks of government information have been hampered by AFP fears that efforts to obtain telephone records and documents from political offices may be regarded as a contempt of parliament.
item.title: Ministerial staff phone records not examined in union raid leak probe

item.description: The news of the day as interpreted by our talented artists, illustrators and cartoonists.
item.title: Best of cartoons, May 29, 2020

item.description: Rosencrantz is polishing his golf clubs.
item.title: Guildenstern is wearing a worried look...

item.description: The finest photos from the international wire agencies as chosen by our picture editors.
item.title: The best of the world in pictures

item.dc:creator: Sumeyya Ilanbey
item.description: The opposition says covering the costs of hotel quarantine for international students will help support a higher education sector crippled by COVID-19 travel bans.
item.title: Revive unis by funding foreign student quarantine, urges opposition

item.dc:creator: David Crowe
item.description: Scott Morrison promises a path out of the decline of VET but is yet to prove he has the map – and the money – to achieve real change.
item.title: Skills gap is the nation's chasm

item.description: Durham police issued a statement saying they had examined the circumstances and they would take no further action against Dominic Cummings.
item.title: 'Minor breach': Johnson's top adviser to face no more action over lockdown trip

item.description: If COVID-19 has shown us anything, it is our ability to adapt, and the risk to the economy of relying on a system where hundreds of thousands of people concentrate in small areas to look at computers together.
item.title: No silver bullet, but we still need faster rail

item.description: Swimmers – and those who live with swimmers – know that swimming isn’t really exercise. It’s a meditation, a circuit breaker and a cleansing ritual that, once you’re in the habit, is as necessary as breakfast.
item.title: This is the one thing I'm really waiting for

item.dc:creator: Anthony Galloway
item.description: Australia has shelved a major review of its $4 billion foreign aid program and will instead redirect hundreds of millions of dollars over the next two years to help countries in the Indo-Pacific tackle the coronavirus pandemic.
item.title: Australia's $4b aid program refocused to deal with COVID-19 recovery

item.dc:creator: Shane Wright
item.description: A revamp of the JobKeeper wage subsidy is being left open by the Morrison government as the Reserve Bank warns ongoing fiscal support will be needed.
item.title: JobKeeper revamp on agenda as RBA warns ongoing support needed

item.description: The news of the day as interpreted in the work of our award-winning cartoonists.
item.title: Today's cartoons: The illustrated news

item.dc:creator: Matt Bungard
item.description: Two people in the same vehicle have died in a head-on collision in Menai, while the driver of the other car has been taken to hospital.
item.title: Two dead after crash in Sydney's south

item.dc:creator: Matt Bungard
item.description: If you suspect you or a family member has coronavirus you should call (not visit) your GP or ring the national Coronavirus Health Information Hotline on 1800 020 080.
item.title: As the day unfolded: JobKeeper extension may be needed says RBA as NSW government defends public sector pay freeze, Australian death toll stands at 103

item.description: Public institutions including museums, theatres and multifunctional halls in the greater Seoul area would again be shut down immediately.
item.title: South Korea tightens restrictions after COVID-19 setback

item.description: The news of the day as interpreted by our talented artists, illustrators and cartoonists.
item.title: Best of cartoons, May 28, 2020

item.dc:creator: Phil Lutton
item.description: The wait was over as sport returned to our screens and Parramatta didn't disappoint as they bolstered their premiership credentials with a thumping of Brisbane.
item.title: Rugby league is back as the Eels flex their muscle to reboot season

item.dc:creator: Rachel Eddie
item.description: If you suspect you or a family member has coronavirus you should call (not visit) your GP or ring the national Coronavirus Health Information Hotline on 1800 020 080.
item.title: As it happened: Victoria records 10 new cases; RBA Governor warns of more job losses; Authorities investigate 30-year-old's death in COVID-free Queensland town

item.description: Harold and the Mexican cowboys take on Where the Hell Park.
item.title: Having a butcher's at sausage metrics

item.description: Australia's men's and women's international schedules for the 2020-21 season have been confirmed.
item.title: Cricket Australia announce international schedule for 2020-21 season

item.dc:creator: Noel Towell
item.description: The Premier wants the federal government to put down its weapons as he warns of the dangers of Victorians surging back onto transport networks.
item.title: Cool it, Andrews urges feds as Victorians surge back to work

item.dc:creator: Dominic Bossi
item.description: A-League players could keep up 95 per cent of their salary as part of a pay deal with FFA that leaves an agreement with Foxtel as the last obstacle to the league's resumption.
item.title: FFA, players reach pay deal to bring A-League return a step nearer

item.dc:creator: Stuart Layt
item.description: Unable to rule out community transmission after a 30-year-old's death, Queensland authorities are calling for widespread testing
item.title: Blackwater residents urged to get tested for COVID-19 as race is on to trace case
